p: Phenolic compounds prevent the enzymatic hydrolysis of carbohydrates by inhibiting α-amylase and α-glucosidase, with a mixed mechanism (competitive and uncompetitive) [ 20]. Previous studies using in vitro and in vivo testing [ 21, 22, 23] demonstrated an antidiabetic activity from the rhizome extracts of C. orchioides and C. latifolia. However, in this work, we found that only the rhizome of C. latifolia showed high antioxidant activity and potent inhibition of α-glucosidase enzyme associated with the high phenolic compounds in plants. In general, high phenolic content, along with high flavonoids in the samples, strongly correlates with antioxidants and α-glucosidase inhibition activities [ 24, 25]. In our studies, the result is not in agreement with previous reports due to antioxidant and α-glucosidase inhibitory activity related to the other compounds, such as terpenoids, steroids, or alkaloids [ 26, 27].
